The werewolf was shocked by the reverse of what was suppose to happen 
(Veratis was suppose to be frozen in place the only catch being that 
Nightmenace had to stay perfectly still while he sucked out his sparks 
energy). He couldn't believe he was restrained. Virtually any material 
bond he could shatter in seconds, but his intellegence MIGHT equal 
that of a gorrila or spider monkey, never a chimp or human. He 
struggled seeing a rock 3 feet around he could launch up at Veratis, 
but couldn't reach it.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Veratis stared down at his adversary, "A lycanthropic cybertronian? 
truly
> remarkable." he noticed the stare and decided to show exactly what 
the beast
> was dealing with. Thier eyes met, A hypnotic gaze was sent toward 
the
> werewolf, The old bot had supressed his nature for to long, he was 
hungry
> for more than the adjusted energeon in his chamber could provide. 
This time
> he was out for the real thing.
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <dewboy30816@y...>
> To: <nbwrpg@y...>
> Sent: Tuesday, November 20, 2001 2:05 PM
> Subject: Re: Arise creatures of the night.
> 
> 
> > Nightmare roared up at the creature. His ears hurt, but only 
certain
> > weapons could do a decent amount of damage to him so it wasn't as 
bad
> > as you might expect. He tried to get a look at Veratis's eyes.
> >
> > OOC: I got the computer problems fixed. Before I could only get on 
at
> > school. This has to do with a weapon Hugar hasn't responded to me
> > about 3 times so I'm just going to go ahead.
> >
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > Veratis heard the creatures battlecry and transformed to his 
half
> > bat mode.
> > > Nightmare was quick and powerful, There was no doubt. The half 
bat
> > flew
> > > skyward screetching an ear splitting tone down towards his 
opponent.
> > The old
> > > scientist had been caught by surprise but experience had given 
him a
> > few
> > > tricks of his own to play with.
> > >
> > >
> > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > From: Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > To: <nbwrpg@y...>
> > > Sent: Tuesday, November 20, 2001 8:40 AM
> > > Subject: Re: Veratis's Problem
> > >
> > >
> > > > Daydream begins to follow, but then the sun sets. An
> > > > overwhelming pain overcomes his very core. He is no
> > > > longer Daydream. In fact he's loosing his sentenence.
> > > > He has just enough for a few words before loosing it
> > > > completely.
> > > >
> > > > Bot: NIGHTMARE BEAST MODE!
> > > >
> > > > He transforms into a raging werewolf and charges at
> > > > Veratis.
> > > >
> > > > --- CYBERWOLF4 <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > > > Veratis saw the look of pain on Daydreams face as he
> > > > > tried to transform.
> > > > > "Perhaps I should take a look at that before we get
> > > > > started." the scientist
> > > > > withdrew a scanner from his side and waved his arm
> > > > > forward. A drone floated
> > > > > forward and a probe slid out of one of it's gripper
> > > > > claws.
> > > > >
> > > > > "It would seem you have a malfunction in your
> > > > > transforming cog." he said
> > > > > recording the bots DNA signature. "Replacing it
> > > > > would be a very short, quick
> > > > > procedure if you would like to have it fixxed." Even
> > > > > though it was just a
> > > > > minor problem he knew that the bot had no reason to
> > > > > trust him. "Think about
> > > > > it and we'll decide back at my home." The old
> > > > > scientist turned and started
> > > > > walking back toward his ship. The drones continued
> > > > > scanning the area for any
> > > > > parasites, radiation, contamination that the pods
> > > > > decent might have left
> > > > > behind. "You may follow if you wish." Veratis
> > > > > started walking towards home
> > > > > hopeing the new bot would follow.
> > > > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > > > From: Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > To: <nbwrpg@y...>
> > > > > Sent: Thursday, November 15, 2001 11:58 AM
> > > > > Subject: Re: Veratis's Problem
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > > > Bot: Yes, it is getting late.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > He motions to the setting sun.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Bot: By the way my name's Daydream. Huh I wonder
> > > > > what
> > > > > > my Beast mode is it doesn't seem to be in my
> > > > > memory
> > > > > > banks. Beast mode.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > He jerks forward in pain.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Daydream: I guess I'll never know.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > --- CYBERWOLF4 <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > > > > > Veratis arives nearby and scans the new bot
> > > > > useing
> > > > > > > his batlike sonar as a
> > > > > > > carrier wave. the arctic snow coated both bots
> > > > > in a
> > > > > > > thin layer of white like
> > > > > > > a thin cold blanket. The old scientist sized up
> > > > > the
> > > > > > > other bot and sensed a
> > > > > > > nonthreatening attitude from the newcomer.
> > > > > Stepping
> > > > > > > forward the scientist
> > > > > > > wrapped his wings around himself causeing them
> > > > > to
> > > > > > > resemble a cloak. His hand
> > > > > > > grasped his speargun beneath in case of
> > > > > emergency
> > > > > > > and the drones hovered
> > > > > > > close remaining slightly behind thier master
> > > > > > > awaiting his instructions.
> > > > > > > "Greetings," Veratis said calmly, "My name is
> > > > > > > Veratis. I invite you into my
> > > > > > > home to rest for as long as need be as my
> > > > > guest."
> > > > > > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > > > > > From: Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > > > To: <nbwrpg@y...>
> > > > > > > Sent: Wednesday, November 14, 2001 8:40 AM
> > > > > > > Subject: Re: Veratis's Problem
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > The pod lands and a confused protohuman walks
> > > > > up
> > > > > > > to
> > > > > > > > it. The dna scanners come online and scan the
> > > > > > > > protohuman, who runs off screaming. A bot
> > > > > tall(9
> > > > > > > ft.),
> > > > > > > > blueish bot comes out.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > --- CYBERWOLF4 <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > Veratis' scanners alert him to the incoming
> > > > > pod.
> > > > > > > > > "Ah, another bot for me to
> > > > > > > > > save from the wages of war." It was still to
> > > > > > > early
> > > > > > > > > to tell if it was a
> > > > > > > > > Maximal or Predacon chip inside but the old
> > > > > > > > > scientist never worried about
> > > > > > > > > those sorts of things. "I guess I'll have to
> > > > > > > take a
> > > > > > > > > short trip to greet our
> > > > > > > > > new guest." The old bot set the scanners on
> > > > > > > > > automatic record and set off to
> > > > > > > > > the north accompanied by three of his
> > > > > drones,
> > > > > > > one of
> > > > > > > > > which carried medical
> > > > > > > > > suplies that might be needed if the bot was
> > > > > > > injured.
